item.title: Seems the builders have closed Regent street/chambers. Havent seen any notices warning us or saying the road will be closed to vehicles as it still says we are permitted till 10am there., 3rd February
item.description:
Outside the old oasis building opposite m&s on the high street. I understand that they need to be there but surely they cannot close a road without warning or notice. You could still get through bit each day their site and lift and barriers get further and further into the road and now means no vehicles can get out there now. Its the only place we are allowed to be, the rear carpark we are not allowed to use as santander kick off and block us in for using their carpark. So there is quite literally no where else for us to go or load from. Then a drinks delivery for the copa or whittle taps blocks us in and we're then waiting and missing all our morning jobs and drops. Thanks Mark
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Regent Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Road surface broken up completely., 3rd February
item.description:
This section of Hewlett Rd outside 163 has now completely broken up becoming a danger to motorists and cyclists. Your inspection a couple of weeks ago in January said that the road didn't meet the criteria for a repair - does it now ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163a, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface cracked badly, 3rd February
item.description:
Outside No.50 Mead Road area of approx. 2 sq. m is sinking and very badly crazed. There is an old repair within part of the area. In my opinion the wide cracks will soon lead to very large pot holes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive potholes of roughly 5cm deep, covered in water, it's a hidden trap, 3rd February
item.description:
Outside the farm house, were the road changes from a nice road to a farm track uncared for road, this road is now breaking my car yearly, I've had to replace 3 tyres, 2 suspension springs and 4 drop links just in the last 18 months because of this road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
